towns.town: wäräda Ganta Afäšum, ṭabiya Dəbla Siʿet, qušät Siʿet

txfndates.txfndate: According to local tradition, the foundation took place during the time of King ʿAmdä Ṣǝyon I (r. 1314-44).

conditions.condition: Däbr. Formerly, the church could have a different name, cp. GSM-002, Zäg(g)abo/Zäg(g)abu Maryam. Currently, the site accomodates two churches. The recent (late 19th or 20th cent.?), rectangular church dedicated to Kidanä Mǝḥrät stands below, and the old rock-hewn church dedicated to St. Mary is located above, cut in the rock. Many holes and small caves can be seen in the vertical rock around its entrance, formerly used as burials (in a few of them wooden caffins could still be seen) or dwellings of the monks. Tabots (7): Kidanä Mǝḥrät, Mary, George, Michael, Trinity, Mädḫane ʿAläm, Twenty-Four Heavenly Priests (marble).

abouts.about: R. PLANT, Architecture of the Tigre, Ethiopia, Worcester 1985, here 100-01, no. 100. R. SAUTER, “Où en sont notre connaissance des églises rupestres d’Éthiopie?” Annales d’Éthiopie 5, 1963, 235-292, here 163, no. 1012.

descriptions.description: 18 Mss., objects photographed: GMS-001 "The Rite of the Holy Week"; GMS-002 "Four Gospels"; GMS-003 "The Book of the Funeral Rite"; GMS-004 "Missal"; GMS-005 "Miracles of Jesus"; GMS-006 "Synaxarion (March)"; GMS-007 "The Book of the Funeral Rite"; GMS-008 "The Faith of the Fathers"; GMS-009 "The Book of the Chants"; GMS-010 "Missal"; GMS-011 "Homily of the Saviour of the World"; GMS-012 "The Book of the Funeral Rite"; GMS-013 "Miracles of Mary"; GMS-014 "Homily of St. Michael"; GMS-015 "Synoptic Lectionary for the Year"; GMS-016 "Vita of Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus"; GMS-017 "The Book of the Matrimony Rite"; GMS-018 "Prayer of Mary"
